main event: A pilot of a Lunar Orbiter spacecraft observed a single white light, similar to a star, approximately 100 miles away and appearing to remain stationary, while flying over the Atlantic Ocean 600 miles northwest of Ascension Island on June 8, 1964.
interesting points: The light was stable or almost stationary and unidentified.
The flight path of the object continued to be observed for 5-10 minutes before it disappeared from view.
The object's speed was estimated at 3-4 times the speed of sound.
The object exhibited rapid acceleration and deceleration, as well as extreme maneuverability.
Further investigation was required to present a final evaluation of this sighting.
sighted object: a single white light, similar to a star
location: 600 miles northwest of Ascension Island, Atlantic Ocean
witnesses: pilot of a Lunar Orbiter spacecraft
